name: Cinderella
description: When her father unexpectedly dies, young Ella finds herself at the mercy of her cruel stepmother and her scheming stepsisters. Never one to give up hope, Ella's fortunes begin to change after meeting a dashing stranger.

review.author: Shriya_
review.heading: Beautiful Live-action re-make of the original
review.reviewBody: Aesthetically speaking, this is my favourite Cinderella re-make. It's so pleasing to the eye, I adore the dress, the scenery, everything is just so perfect. It's an absolute visual delight. My favourite Cinderella re-make, in general, though, is Ever after with Drew Barrymore. I can never get tired of re-watching that one. Whereas this one, I would watch for the aesthetics, which I simply adore. In my opinion, the storytelling could have been stronger in this one, they could have added more comedic, mystery elements etc ...something to make it a little different (just as Ever-after did). Unfortunately, it doesn't stray that much from the original animated Cinderella and having some sort of twist or a different interpretation/ other elements added to it would have made this film more interesting and elevated it to a whole other level. I still recommend it, however, if simply for the aesthetics alone, it's a live animation that's absolutely beautiful to watch. It would have been lovely to have seen this in the cinema - on the big screen - it's gorgeous.

keywords: dance,remake,fairy tale,17th century,based on fairy tale
